Reviews.Title: “Fine, good location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Mike
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel with helpful staff in good location. Taxi drivers seemed to have major problems finding it though. No bar, and breakfast was extra so we headed to nearby cafe for a very good value option every morning. Easy to walk to centre - close to University. Beds were hard, pillows inadequate and room temperature impossible to control. Gave us a very dark room that smelt very strongly of cleaning fluids first, but readily swapped to much nicer room overlooking street with balcony on request. One word of warning - I used the rooftop jacuzzi which was nice but I slipped and injured myself badly when I got out. My fault really but it was a very hard fall and I'm in plaster as a result. Luckily I was with friends, hate to think what would have happened had I been up there on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: The_Good79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (we're from a suburb near Toronto, Canada) stayed here June 24-26, 2011. We were taking a mediterrainian cruise which embarked from Barcelona and stayed here for 2 nights prior to our cruise. This was our first time in Barcelona. We've travelled the world (I used to be a travel agent) so we have experienced it all (luxurious accomodations, 5 stars to below average/poor accomodations. To sum this hotel up (it was recommended by a respected travel agent we've dealt with for years), you won't find a hotel in Barcelona that gives you the best value overall than Sunotel Central. Here is my review: Cleanliness: One of the main positives is this hotel is extremely clean. Our room, the lobby, everything is kept spotless. Food: there is a restaurant which serves breakfast. We never ate there although from what we've read and heard the food is very good. Rooms: the rooms are extremely tiny and tight, but very clean. It was tight for 2 people. One set of rooms face the street, these rooms are louder but arguably more interesting as you can open you window and look out onto the street. We stayed in the rooms at the back of the hotel, which are quieter and look out at the backs of other hotels/apartments. I was fun opening the window (no screens like north american buildings) and looking out. Roof top pool: we never used it but went to check it out. Looked very tiny but very clean. I wish I had swam and tanned there. Location: great!!! You can walk to La Rambla (Barcelona's version of Times Square, Piccadilly Circus or Toronto's Yonge St, Paris' Champs Elysees, if you will) within 15-20 mins. Plus this hotel is located near a University and is in a very safe area. Can't beat it. If you stay near La Rambla you'd be paying at least double the price. Service: very average. When we arrived from the airport, a very nice young man let us leave our bags with the front desk hours before check in. Another time the male at the front desk wasn't very friendly. Overall: this hotel is small, clean, interesting, in a great location and overall the best value for you money. Nothing fancy but I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awful bed. Noisy. Great location. Not a 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Pirocapl
Reviews.Content: There are pros and cons about everything in life - and when it comes to Sunotel Central, there are more cons than pros! Pros: 1. Great location. It's only a 5 min walk from the Universitat subway station. 2. The breakfast was a bit pricey but worth the money! (14 euros per person) 3. Friendly staff - most of them were bilingual 4. Wi-Fi in the room (worked fine all the time) 5. Clean room - the bathroom was perfectly clean! Cons: 1. Bed: TOO SHORT! I could barely fit in! ROCK HARD. Awful mattress. Had a hard time sleeping there. Got me a backache! 2. Spanish style pillows - flat and small. 3. Noisy #1 (I had a room w/ a balcony facing the main street) 4. Noisy #2 (Loud guests screaming in the hall/rooms. Complained but nothing happened.) 5. Noisy #3 (Can hear the shower next door) 6. The mini-bar wouldn't refrigerate anything. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone willing to spend more than 2 nights in Barcelona. The location is great but I am sure there are other hotels in the area with better beds and less noisy than Sunotel. It is not a 4 star hotel by all means!

Reviews.Title: “A couple of problems”
Reviews.Author: Oofie46
Reviews.Content: Firstly they advertised there hotel as being airconditioned, but because it was "Spring" it was still set for cold weather and we could only have warm air. They at least tried to do the right thing and give us a room on the cooler side of the hotel, but we had to sleep with our windows open and even though on the 6th floor it was very very noisy. Our second problem was that within a half an hour of being in the room we had some male person open our door and walk in, he couldnt speak english so we had no idea why he was there, the same thing happened the next morning when another male opened our door and tried to come in while we were still in bed even though our door was locked. He obviously had a key and when we asked reception why, they stated he was checking the mini bar. He didnt even bother to knock. just walked in. Otherwise location was great and rooms were clean, and staff, (those that werent walking into our rooms) were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was adequate, rooms were small and very basic, the wifi was non existent and the jacuzzi wasn't switched on. I would not stay here again but it did the job!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location & fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Sally A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights during February 2012, I could not recommend this hotel more! It is firstly in a fantastic location, just a 5minute walk from La Rambla, plus the airport bus stopped a few metres away from our hotel, you are right beside a Metro line too, location is perfect! When we first arrived the man at the reception greeted us warmly and gave us a map and explained about Barcelonas beauty and where to go then he also kindly warned us about it’s pick pocketing problem, which I think was very kind and helpful. Every morning we had a delicious breakfast with plenty of variety. The prices were very reasonable and I found the rooms lovely, we had a balcony which was a real treat over looking the busy road below. We are the type of people that like to get loads out of our holiday and so this hotel was perfect for us as we slept great there, had a big breakfast and felt very at home. Also I must add all the staff we spoke to there were very nice and polite, thumbs up for Sunotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in great location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CARUZZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for visiting the centre of Barcelona. Only a 10 minute walk from the Rambles. It is easily reached by the airport shuttle bus. Drop off point Universitat. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and fine for a short break. We stayed 4 nights, and had a room at the back of the hotel, that was very quiet. We didn't eat at the hotel as the breakfast was not included, and would have cost us 15 euros each. But there were plenty of small cafes only a short walk away where you could get coffee and breakfast for a quarter of the price. This Hotel gives you the best of both worlds. Quiet but only 10 mins walk from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Weak WiFi”
Reviews.Author: bobolo
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent with a short walk to Placa Catalunya and The Ramblas. The room was on the small side, but my complaint is with the free wifi. The signal was so week we had to leave the hallway door open to connect. We changed rooms but no signal at all in that room. The staff tried to fix it but no results. If you need wifi, and I did, then this isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Jan12”
Reviews.Author: ruthy1957_12
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, clean, good breakfast, helpful staff. We had a front room with a balcony which was great. It was a bit noisy but we didn't mind. It was in a very central location. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Alternative”
Reviews.Author: nermacis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just past the University of Barcelona. However it is an easy walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. There are also buses across the road to the city, Montjuic, Placa Espanya, and other places. The rooms are comfortable and clean. At the back of the hotel, the rooms are particularly light and quiet with an outlook over surburban life. This is not the case for all rooms. There is a roof top pool and deck with views to the water and Montjuic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelGirl086
Reviews.Content: I disagree with some of the reviews. The rooms are clean and spacious. My room was in the back of hotel with a very large window facing out to other apartments and terraces. There was a long table under weindow with outlets, very convenient. I was able to walk to most places, and not far from this hotel was a great tappas restaurant reccomended by staff. I could not complain about breakfast, it was generous and served in a very nice room. I don't know price, mine was included in my room rate. Staff was friendly and accomadating, hotel was clean and quiet. Good choice if leaving out of Barcelona on a cruise, not far from port.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: PietroVarese
Reviews.Content: the location is amazing, very nice the last floor rooms.. I will come back at Sunotel Central when I'll be again in Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Bed's are really bad”
Reviews.Author: pricha3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 2 blocks from where the Airport bus drops you off 4 at the Plaça Universitat which made transfer easy. However, unless you take a taxi back to the airport the bus does not pick up at the Place Universitat but rather Plaça Catalunya which is a 6-8 block walk. We wound up at this hotel because Booking.Com (DO NOT USE) and/or the Marriott messed up our reservation and the Marriott was booked. The highlights of this hotel is that it is within a 6-8 block walk from central Barcelona, two blocks to a good subway station, the folks at the front desk are extremely helpful, and the room is clean. The biggest negative is the bed is awful. It looks and feels like only a one piece modified box (no real mattress). If you get a really good deal on this hotel, it may be a good buy but for us it was slightly over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with fabulous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: deckard34
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October and the weather was red hot. I agree with a previous review this is more a 3 star than 4. The location is great with Las Ramblas a short stroll away and friendly and helpful staff. However i had a room overlooking the street which was busy and noisy. The highlight was the breakfast which was fab with enough choice for anyone, including plenty of cake :)

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not good enough”
Reviews.Author: msox182
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say? 5 nights costing 2 adults £849 I was expecting more. When we arrive we got what I can only describe as the smallest hotel room in the world, couldn't even walk round the room it was so small and you could see all the pipes and inserlation(spelling?!) through the vents. We immediately complained and got a new "standard" room the next day which was 100 times better, decent size, nice balcony view and good sized bathroom. Great location for las ramblas and universitat metro so on that note I would recommend it but it's not a 4 star hotel at all, 3 star would suit this without question, staff were friendly and great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kate08
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a good central location then this is the hotel for you. 2 metro stations nearby bus stop outside the door the aerport bus drops you 5 minute walk away and 10 to 15 minute walk to la rambla and about 20 to 25 minute walk to plaza espanya. not a 4 star hotel but has everything you need yes it can be noisy and could do with an update but what do you want only a bed to sleep in there is so much to see and do in barcelona. the staff were very helpful and pleasant. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: RenrenLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Sunotel and were pleasantly surprised. It was a great location, accross the road from the University, and easy walking distance to Las Ramblas, and all the main shopping areas. Plus we got a great rate through lastminute.com. The only complaint we could find was the bed was a little hard, in saying that though, we slept soundly and didn't actually notice it during the night. Also don't expect too much from the pool, it's a little bigger than a jacuzzi, but still nice for a quick dip, and a sunbake on the roof. The staff weren't particularly knowledgable on things we wanted to know, like a laundrette, but just head to the tourist information, and they were great. Definitely would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: TravelcrazyDublin
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel for a city break. This was our second trip to Barcelona but our first to this hotel. This hotel is in an excellent location, the metro station is very close by and it is also only a short walk to Las Rambles. The staff at the front desk were both friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable, nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. The beds were confortable and we slept really well for the four nights we were there. It was very hot while we were there and the air conditioning was excellent in the room. The pool on the roof is great of cool off in after a day sightseeing and there was always plenty of sunbeds and clean towels available. We stayed on a room only basis and we felt that it was excellent value for money. There are a number of nice cafes and bakery's nearby for breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GutenAllie
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I knew not to expect a 4 star hotel (it was still a good 3 star), and we were so glad we chose this hotel! The location was excellent- we were able to walk to all the major sites except for the beach (we took the subway)- some of the walks were longer walks, but still easy. The location is on the edge of the Old Town (i.e. La Rambla) and Eixample (great shopping/museums/Sangrada Familia), so we could walk easily just about anywhere. Also, the two closest subway stations (Universitat and Catalyuna) connect to just about everywhere and were easy to use. The pool/jacuzzi on the rooftop were great- the pool was small but big enough for a dip to cool down, and it stayed open until 10pm. The air conditioner in the room worked great except for the one night we accidentally turned it off. Don't do that! Our room (708) was a good size and faced the inner courtyard, so it was quiet. We were right next to the elevator but didn't hear it at all. Getting there from the airport was easy. We took the Aerobus from the airport and it dropped off at Playa Universitat, which is only a block from the hotel (walk toward Starbucks), and was very convenient. To return to the airport, pick it up at Playa Catalyuna- also easy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't have the breakfast (too expensive for what it was) but there were lots of cafes around that opened early and served great food- our favorite was a half block away in the direction of Universitat that had the BEST smoothies. Worth a stop. There is also a Starbucks a block away, but the "local" cafes are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very central in the city, not too small rooms”
Reviews.Author: GuErPe
Reviews.Content: It ist a 4* hotel, but I would give them max. 3*. But the location is nice and they have a pool on the roof where you have a nice view over the roofs of the old town and you even see the sea. I stayed 8 nights, all the time the room was a little dusty - room cleaning should be improved. I had a room facing Gan Via, you can hear the traffic and the busses (bus stop in front of the entrance of the hotel, but you have a direct bus to the beaches). Nevertheless if you are not too sensible I can advice this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to metro and walking distance to city centre”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak-ie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when we were on a city break in Barcelona with a number of friends and had absolutely nio complaints. The best feature of the hotel is undoubtedly its location - it is close to the metro and within a walking distance to Las Ramblas. It is an excellent base for exploring Barcelona. The service was very friendly and helpful. The Reception were full of recommendations on what to see and what' on. The rooms were good size and clean, beds comfortable and the balcony was facing the main road which does tend to get noisy but the windows kept the sound off and the quality of sleep was great. Fantastic value for money deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scowy68
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here,just a short walk from La Rambla,plenty of little bars/restaurants near the hotel as well.The staff we're very helpful,the food was a good selection for breakfast,and the room was spotlessly clean,what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: dotman60
Reviews.Content: My room was so small I had to put my bag on the bed to move around the bed. The phone in the room was from 1950 purchased at a discount store. The bed was like sleeping on a hard carpet. When you took a shower the floor flooded. Found spider in tub the size of half dollar. They never replaced the glass used my entire week. Breakfast food was good but very expensive. TV channels were very few and most in Spanish, only English was BBC.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: midliferSheffield_Uk Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally placed for sightseeing and access to metro etc. Room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was superb. We will definitely stay here on future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money paid”
Reviews.Author: karinamarinad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. I agree with other reviews that it is a 3 star hotel, not 4 star, but we booked again through Last minute . com and got a very good deal. Great central location, room quite large, also bathroom was good, apart from a couple of rust spots in the bath. Bed and pillow very comfey. I must say you can hear noise though the walls from other rooms, also through the vent in the bathroom, but that improved after weekend guests moved out ! I had read previous reviews so asked when we arrived for a bedroom overlooking the rear of the building. We were given our room, but found it was next to the lift !!!. My husband went back to reception and they gave us another room on the third floor, no problem. We found the staff very helpful . We had a problem with the safe not working, but took our laptop and valuables to reception each morning, and they put them into the hotel safe. Free WiFi a bonus, but can be hard to connect too ! Parking was good, though rather a tight fit to get our car in under the hotel and well priced at 18 Euro a day. We did not have breakfast, as on the corner next to the hotel, we had coffee and a pastry for 2 Euros. There is no bar or restaurant, but so many near by, so not really a problem for us.. Overall, we were very happy and would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “very good location/ great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: danielaberbece
Reviews.Content: we staid for 3 nights in February. the room was small but very clean, bathroom was shiny and new, as all the furniture. the breakfast was variate and very good, service ok. in front of the hotel you have a bus station to Catalunia or to the airport, on the corner you have subway. Paseo de Gracia over the corner. i really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “10 MINUTES WALK FROM RAMBLA”
Reviews.Author: Vispol
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not far from the University which is close to the Rambla main shopping area of Barcelona. Hotel is comfortable and rooms look like they have been recently redone. However, rooms are no frill - no complimentary tea/coffee/water. Reception staff average. Not very courteous. Breakfast is expensive in the hotel but at the corner outside the hotel is a very nice American style cafe with good breakfast and excellent coffee. Even the food for lunch and dinner is good value. Excellent and friendly service in the cafe. Further round the corner is a small grocery store where you can buy all what you need in your room. I once stayed at Continental Hotel on the Rambla and that hotel had free food and soft drinks served in the lobby 24/7 which was quite nice for the family to have a bite from time to time in between meals. Unfortunately that hotel has no windows in the normal rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great location OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: juebev
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Room was very clean, nice decor, very quiet at the back of the hotel. The room was a bit on the small side and the bed was quite hard, but it was fine for me as it was a good price, through Lastminute.com and the location is excellent. But it is not really 4 star - there,s no bar and only a breakfast restaurant - for 14 euros!!! Of course you can go round the corner and have coffee and croissants for 2 or 3 euros .The guy on reception was disinterested and there was no hotel info in the rooms. But I was quite happy with the 2 star price I payed and would use it again at that price

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money, clean, freindly and safe”
Reviews.Author: alissamoore
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel with my sister. Upon arrival the staff were freindly, so always a good for a first impression. We stayed in a twin room at the back of the hotel that was very bright, modern, sunny and warm. The bathroom was a great size and the shower clean and good. The beds were hard but I managed to sleep well on it, the walls must have been quite thin as you could sometimes hear snoring from next door! But these things did not affect our stay it felt secure and welcoming and overall a pretty good location to the metro (5min) and la Ramblas (10 mins walk) would definately go back to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel centrally located in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: thearndt
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at the Sunotel Central. Room size was OK (larger than expected, as I had read reviews saying that the rooms can be really small), I had a window facing the courtyard which I would recommend, as the main road is really noisy and air quality isn't too good. The whole thing seems quite recently renovated; all interior was nicely built and seemed kind of stylish and well-designed (odd then that they still have mechanical keys). Breakfast is good (quite wide choice and large enough room), staff was very friendly. You can hear some things from the rooms around you, though, but no big issue. Free and fast WiFi. Close enough to walk to La Rambla and many other places. Would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: unhappy023
Reviews.Content: stayed here for five nights. Hotel room clean and nice. Location for sightseeing quite good. Main complaint is that hotel was advertised as being four star with various facilities but this was not true. The restaurant was only open at weekends. There wa no room service and no bar. No tea or coffee making facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, value for money”
Reviews.Author: nanachi
Reviews.Content: very central location, the service was average, the breakfast was a good variety of food, the room was clean and average, but for what you pay you get a nice room in universidad. walking distance to plaza catalunya and passeig de gracia where everything is happening.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy room, poor service but good location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: idylledr
Reviews.Content: hotel's rooms are very small and lightining systems are poor. beds are very unconfortable and air contidition was not working very well. breakfast was good but its beginning time is not suitable for business people. location is ok not to far to airport ant near to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ringride
Reviews.Content: We were returning from a cruise which finished in Barcelona so only in Barcelona for 1 night before flying home so needed to stay somewhere central. This hotel was ideal for that, only a very short walk to central areas. Rooms were quite spacious. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Price included breakfast which was very good indeed, a very good selection. Rooms were all clean and comfortable.Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good breakfast, clean but miniscule room”
Reviews.Author: LyttonLondon
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Jazz Hotel but due to a medical convention in Barcelona, we had a problem finding anywhere to stay, even though I was booking five months prior to our stay. The Sunotel Central was offered as one of the British Airways recommended hotels and we booked it as part of our flight package with BA. Although we arrived around 11am, the staff went out of their way to ensure that we could be accommodated immediately and we cannot praise them highly enough - they were friendly, efficient and very welcoming. The room was the biggest let-down. It really should have been classed as a single room as the double bed was pushed up to the wall so that to get into bed you either had to launch yourself from the foot of the bed or climb over the other person. Our room was next to the lift which clunked and clattered. However, it was a quiet room at the back (no view, but at least it was quiet). My husband and I had a suitcase each but there was not room to open even one of them - we had to place them on the bed before we could open them. The furnishings were fine, althought the bed was rock hard, and the bathroom was also fine and provided with shampoo, shower gel etc. The self-service breakfast was really very good (included in our package) and constantly replenished. We caught the Aerobus 1 from the airport and it cost 3.5 Euros each - bargain. There is a commentary on the bus indicating which stop is coming up and we just watched and listened for Universitat. The hotel is about 3 minutes walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterHStocktononTees
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed for ready access to all the major attractions in Barcelona. We prefer to walk in the cities we visit but on the hottest of days we were 5 mins walk away from the metro (which is also great value). The staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and comfortable, bed linen changed every other day and fresh towels every day. Breakfast in the dining room is the full range from fresh fruit, cold continental style ham and cheese, hot bacon and sausage, both conventional and corizo, with a tortilla (frittata) and the local tomato bread, all rounded off with a slice of cake or cheesecake if desired, setting us up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good location but not worth a 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: dani11111
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the sunotel central Barcelona. On arrival you find that none of the staff speak good English and that, to be honest, they are all a bit miserable. If you suffer from claustrophobia you will get a shock when you see the size of a basic room - the photos do not prepare you for how small it really is. They are mostly clean although we did have some hairs to wash down the plug hole in the bath before we dare use it. The breakfast is equally disappointing - not much choice, poor quality, cold and geared towards other nationalities in the main. The hotel does offer you a reasonable location from which to explore Barcelona but if you do not want to pay for a bus tour you will walk huge numbers of miles during your stay. Barcelona is well worth a visit though. A lovely, safe-feeling city with friendly people, good food and warm climate. It helps to put the disappointments of the hotel into perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bwaller
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews of the hotel I was a little concerned as to what I would find when I arrived there. I should not have worried. The hotel is ideally located with only a 10-15 minute walk to Las Ramblas. Yes the road where it stands is busy - but most of them are in Barcelona. There are 2 Metro stations close by also. The hotel is officially classed as 4 star but realistically is a 3 star. The rooms are smallish but in my view you don't go to Barcelona to stay in your room. We were allocated a room on the 7th Floor with a very large balcony overlooking the main road with a superb view over the rooftops of the city. Some rooms however do not have this luxury and have an internal window looking out onto a central service area in the centre of the hotel. The rooftop terrace also has stunning views of the city and is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle with its small pool, jacuzzi and showers - all free to guests (even the towels are provided). Did not opt for breakfast as it appeared expensive at 14 euros per person but chose to eat at one of the nearby terrace cafes. The receptionists were always polite and willing to help and spoke very good English. Would I return to Barcelona and this hotel ?. Yes & Yes !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location sure, but that's about it....”
Reviews.Author: JasonThompstone
Reviews.Content: I am writing to advise you of certain details about our stay at the Sunotel,in Barcelona, of which I am far from happy. First of all there was no functioning air conditioning in our hotel room. Given that the temperature in Barcleona was c. 34c this was near intolerable. Secondly, the extractor fan in our bathroom did not work. Given that there were no windows in this room either, this probably led to the awful smell which emanated from the room. Thirdly the reception were rude and unhelpful. I advised the hotel reception of these matter on the first day of our stay. In response to the heating, the receptionist laughed at my matter of fact statement that the room was cooler with the window open . He indiacted that the hotel often has complaints about it's air conditioning - as if that was ok. Nothing was done to addrress eiether the air conditioning or extractor fan issues during our stay. On departure I indiacted that I would not have been happy to pay for my stay and recieved a muted apology.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but will not use again”
Reviews.Author: bnw1701
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 4 star hotel. The rooms are adequate but the 'double bed' was just to singles pushed together so don't expect to actually sleep in the same bed as your partner if you have one or in comfort if you don't. Bathrooms are ok. There is no air conditioning despite the front desk insisting there is. The temperature does not go below 17 degrees celcius which is nearly has warm as an english summer and the fan would struggle to compete with anything other than a small feather. The staff are just rude and unhelpful , at least until you leave and they couldn't be more helpful (tip time maybe?) The breakfast is very good, very good selection and plenty of it. Great location very central and just a 5-10 minute walk to La Rambla. If you can get it at a very good price then it is adequate but no more than that. Barcelona is buzzing. The historical north side is a great couple of days out. Watch out for the beggers as they are persistant. Don't get robbed by the restaurants on the main streets, find where the locals eat in the side streets. Can't wait to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Sunotel Central - Great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JoAmey
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2010. Our experince of the hotel is a good one. We arrived safe and sound at bacrelona airport, took the Aerobus from the airport to the hotel, 5 euros each and well worth every cent. Check in at the hotel was very fast and were direct to our room. The room was spacious enough for 2 girls (who always pack too much) for the duration of our stay. We were in room 509 which was located at the rear of the hotel (away from the busy road). It was very clean, the bathroom large with super shower above the bath. Everything you would expect from a hotel, expect no tea/coffee making facilities.... I suppose this was to encourage you to use the bar facilities in reception or pay for the buffet breakfast.... expect the bar was not open once the whole time we were there and the breakfast was 14 euros each.. All said the hotel was good value for money and in a great location for what we paid, we booked a package deal through last minute. I would stay here agin and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay & Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shaunus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend and got a fab deal direct with the hotel which included breakfast late check out and free mini bar for a very reasonable price. The hotel was well situated and within 5 mins walk of Placa Catalunya and 2 mins to Univeristat Metro station. The area was safe and as 2 females we never felt threatened. The only downside and this is no fault of the hotel was that there was a very large group of people in the hotel who made the most noise and were very loud and didnt seem to respect others in the hotel and this spoilt it slightly but hopefully they wouldnt be there the same time as us again! I would defintely recommend the hotel to others. The breakfast was lovely and again the staff pleasant and attentive. Very pleasant stay. The views from the rooftop were fab but the pool was definetly too cold at this time of year but would imagine it would be fantastic in the warmer months - maybe I need to go back to check that out ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: shangoNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Hotel only approx. 15 mins from airport in taxi (be careful with taxis, fare on meter not what you pay when you arrive at destination,dependant on how many people and how much luggage in the taxi). Returned to airport by bus 5 euro each, bus to be caught at palya de catalunya. Friendly welcome on arrival and given choice of room due to the hotel not being full(picked room at back of hotel due to hotel being on the main road). Room clean and fresh and serviced to a good strandard each day, only critisicm of room would be no tea or coffee making facilities. Fridge and mini bar prices in line with the rest of barcelona(expensive). Great breakfast each morning (included in price). Hot breakfast, cereals, cold meats, pastries and all the usual stuff. Great location, step outside hotel and within 500 yards you were at Playa de Catalunya and la rambla which are both at the heart of Barcelona. Plenty of bars, restaurents and tapas places within walking distance. Overall good hol in great hotel in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great - but Really Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: JulesTravel
Reviews.Content: For the rate we got, this hotel was a real gem. Great location and was super clean. Even by NA standards, the room was certainly large enough and the bathroom was nicely renovated with a lovely bath and shower. The products were nice also. We arrived very early after disembarking from our cruise ship and the hotel was full ... so we had to sit in the lobby to wait as none of the restaurants or shops were even open and we did not expect to get a room that early anyway but were too weary to do anything else than sit on the comfy sofa in the lobby and rest a bit. The early desk guy was amazingly kind and so soon as someone checked out he got the room cleaned and gave us a key. We crashed for a good hour or so (after a 7 day med cruise we were beat) ... at this point, we loved this hotel! Ok - the downside ... we walked all around Barcelona for the entire day ... and made sure to stay out the entire evening because the only english channel on our tele was BBC world news but the sound did not work on that channel! So we came back to the room around 10:30pm to get a good nights sleep for our early flight out of BCN ... and would you believe - they have a Cabaret right under our room! We were on the first floor. Holy you know what! I went down and of course the hotel was full so we could not move. So, thankfully I had an IPod so I could tune out the very, very loud noise. And, the beds are dead hard and one little pillow. Overall, some really great points but some really big downsides too ... that's the luck of the draw I suppose! PS ... if you want to really party in Barcelona ... this is the perfect spot ... 'cuz you would not care about the noise and the hard beds and it is indeed, a superb location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cass65
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful indeed. The breakfast facilities were excellent and beautifully presented with a wide choice to suit everyone. All spotless. However, what spoiled it for us was the very small room that looked out onto the central service shaft. There was no fresh air and it was impossible to even tell what the weather was like without going downstairs and out into the street! Had we been given a better room, we would be very pleased to go back there. Perhaps we should have requested a change at the start. The location was brilliant - walking distance from Metros and bus stop right on direct route from airport. Aquarelle mentioned is 65 to 80 euros pp and only at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “sparkling clean”
Reviews.Author: alenapepa
Reviews.Content: We loved it.The hotel is on the bus line from the airport; we were able to check in early in the morning; rooms were small(europien small) but sparkling clean and comfortable. Name CENTRAL fits, you are very close to everything.2 min from Ramblas, 10 min from Sagrada; we walked everywhere and it seemed short distance to all wonderful. places.You dont have to eat breakfast in the hotel(but it s excellente buffet),there is so many coffee shops around you might want to explore.Our room was very small with ugly view to the 10x10 opening in the center of the building,BUT it was quiet all night no sound heard at all, plus dark and cozy.Even with jat lag,we slept soundly all night till 10 am. NEGATIVE::: jaccuzy on the roof soooo cold, no hot water, so pretty much usless for us.Otherwise great view from the roof 's pool,charming idea.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: marcopolowow
Reviews.Content: Modern 4 star hotel in the heart of Barcelona with very nice, young staff. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “good choice. clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: nickoengland
Reviews.Content: we were here for 5 days in early august. great location and good room with balcony over looking the grand avenue to the front of hotel. rooms are not huge but clean with good bathroom ( sink , bath / shower, bidet ). modern refurbed hotel - 8 storey building. the air con was essential and roof terrace with pool was a great feature. this is a good base and comfortable standard. lovely 10 minute walk to the top of the Ramblas. Stylish Cafes on same block as hotel with shops, banks, pharmacy very close 50 meters away. We took the aerobus from the airport and got off at Universitat square - 75 meters walk from bus stop . We read reviews beforehand - and have a good tip for Americans = dont pester the people on the front desk and you will have not much to moan and whinge about - sort your own holiday details out ! we did not bother the front desk exept to hand the key over ; this is a great place to stay - and very good standard -

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Not glamorous or something but ok”
Reviews.Author: CruiserTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during July. The rooms are clean. The staff could be more friendly but is ok. My phone was broken they told me "tomorrow fix". When pushed a little bit - just asked the cleaning lady to replace. Why not to do it in the first place ? My room faced the Gran via Catalones which is pretty noisy especially at the morning but we got early enough for it not to bother. A little far from the Rambla and the port and Plazza Espania. About 15-20 minutes walk from both ( two difference directions )

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: crazyinjun
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip on Priceline with the requirements of 4 star and in La Rambla / La Barceloneta and we ended up with this hotel. The location was okay, but was at the edge of the entire Las Ramblas area. The rooms were hardly that of a 4 star. It was more like a 2.5/3 star. The rooms were small but had sufficient. It was close to the Universitat subway stop which we ended up taking everywhere. Don't get suckered into saying "4 star in La Rambla" with Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CB10London
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute trip to Barcelona for the weekend and got a great deal at Sunotel Central. The hotel is in a good location- in walking distance to all the attractions in the city, and also close to the Metro if you prefer. The room was on the small side- but for a weekend trip it is fine since you spend so little time in it anyways. The room & bathroom were very clean, and I had no problems with anything. I would say the room is very basic, no extras or frills. There is a rooftop pool which looked nice but I did not have a chance to use. As I was a young female travelling on my own to Barcelona for the first time, I was concerned about safety and the area of the hotel. The location was very safe and I had no problems at all. If you are looking for an affordable hotel in a good location and don't need anything extravagant, then I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greal Location, Clean, Inexpensive & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fleshti
Reviews.Content: Although other people might be dissatisfied with dullness (hard-euro-beds, dark hallways, dated decor), I thought the 'Sunotel Central' to have all the hotel commodities I needed and which were lacking in other Barcelona hotels (2 points for the pool & free wifi). The Specifics: - Great location! Just a 3 minute walk from the subway & a few steps from Plaza Universidad. - service was friendly and prompt, check-in only took about 5 minutes (so did check-out) - The pool is small but clean - the room + bathroom were clean although on the small side (not tiny) - bed was firm / but not as short as other euro-beds (no lumps in bed either) - our room had a cute balcony that looked out unto the main street ( I wouldn't be able to tell you if it's quiet or not because that same night FC Barcelona won the 'Copa Del Rey' soccer match against Bilbao, thus rioting ensued on the main street from which my cute little balcony overlooked). Overall it's an excellent budget hotel with all the necessary basics for a comfortable hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBee
Reviews.Content: Overall, my stay here was great. I'm VERY picky and paranoid about cleanliness, and the room was definitely quite clean. Looking at positives and negatives: Positives: Location (although a bit further from LaRamblas than I thought), AC was great, FREE WI-FI IN ROOM (huge for me), clean, the hotel seemed into being environmentally friendly Negatives: Walls are paper thin, everytime someone closed their door the room shook; hot tub was borderline cold, tiny pool, room quite small (although I don't really mind that too much), terrible view from the room, towels at the pool weren't always there (staff got them quickly though), expensive food/drinks

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: OwenBou
Reviews.Content: Secured this hotel for $100 USD / night on priceline bidding. It's blocks from La Rambla ( the main tourist, bar street). I have not yet seen anything in same value. First the bad: - the pool is very small ... but still good for cooling off - the hot tub is not hot and serves no purpose - the rooms come with two twins that need to be pushed together to make a bigger size - the hotel bar seems to be closed at all hours of the day - no ironing board or iron - very thin walls ... you can hear any bangs or bumps in surrounding rooms Now the good: - the AC is very solid in the rooms and the temperature control is very easy to manage - location is clutch ... extremely central and in a nice area just north west of La Rambla - price was great ... paid $100 / night - good clean hotel - relatively speedy and free internet available in every room - nice showers too

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: AchingFeet
Reviews.Content: Considering that Barcelona is quite expensive--especially with the dollar-to-euro rate, this was a good value. I believe they claim to be rated 4 stars, but I would have thought that the rooms are too small to deserve such a rating--at least in the US. Pluses: Rooms are very clean, 24-hour front desk staff extremely friendly and helpful with ALL questions and requests, mini-fridge, quiet (but my room window opened to interior court), close to Metro, within walking distance to Barcelona's center. Minuses: Available Internet but no PCs in rooms (lug your own laptop), small rooms (personally, I wasn't affected but others might be), very expensive breakfast in their restaurant ( ~15 euros = $21 at 06/09 rates). More than likely, the hotel I will stay in again on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: brumeeboi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, location, staff in the beautiful city of Barcelona! Stayed during the time FC Barcelona won La Liga and the whole city came out to play - fantastic, even for a die hard Villa fan. This city loves it's team and it's football. Our room was at the back of the hotel and overlooking private residential apartments - very pretty and quiet, even during the Barca football celebrations. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: Sunotel Central sells as a 4 star hotel but I think this is somewhat misleading. There is nothing seriously wrong with the hotel, but if you'd told me it was a 3 star, I would have been satisfied. The location is good (about 5-10min walk from the top of La Rambla), but other than that, everything else was average. For a quick city weekend break (where I don't want to pack a lot), I expect a 4 star hotel to provide a number of basic things, such as conditioner (there is shampoo but no conditioner), a shower cap, an iron (there is a shared ironing room but I would expect a 4 star hotel to have an in-room iron), and for the housekeeping to clear the trash for example. Also, there were only 2 pillows (one each) and I had to ask 3 times for another pillow as I sleep on 2 pillows (posture reasons). Also, as there is only one person on at reception at one time, the wait is long and service is slow. There is also no wi-fi in room as advertised, only in the hotel lobby. So anyway, if you're going to stay at Sunotel Central, go for it, but be prepared for a 3 star hotel instead of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not qualified as 4* luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldydy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was given to us through Priceline bidding as a 4* rating. The first impression of the hotel appearance and lobby do not look like a 4*. Following is my observation: Pros: 1. The room is clean but very basic. 2. The front staff and the maid was helpful. We needed to have hot water to drink because of cold. There is no coffee maker in the room, so the maid found us a boiler. 3. The location is good. It is very close to la Rambla. 4. The wireless internet is free. Yes. FREE !! Very rare in Europe.... Cons: 1. The lighting is very "environmentally/economically" friendly. (a) The light would turn off after around 3 min in the washroom of the hotel lobby although someone was still in it. It was weird that we needed to look for the switch in the dark and manually switched on the light couple of times. (b) The hallway is always dark unless someone walks through. Very dark.. 2. The hotel is severely undermanned. (a) We and other guests were locked out of the hotel because the front desk person was not there. It was around 6pm/7pm. We tried at least 5 min to ring the bell before the person came back. She didn't say anything to us at all. (b) We were first given a room where the air conditioning did not work. There was no technician to help. The only front desk person came but she had no idea how the thing operates. We asked for a room on the same floor as my parents'. The room was not ready until 6~7 pm. I talked to the maid. She told me that she was the only person cleaning the entire hotel in the afternoon. No wonder it took forever. 3. The room was made but the trash was left on the table and inside the washroom. We stayed there for 4 nights. After the 2nd day, it was not hard to notice that the floor was never cleaned or wiped. Overall, it is a clean hotel with very basic room and service.

Reviews.Title: “to be recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Stof3
Reviews.Content: Ideally located if you want to visit Barcelona . We slept there 3 nights . Room located on the 7th floor, view on the back side of the hotel : very very quiet. We slept with opened windows and NO noise. Don't hesitate to ask for a quiet room on booking (what I have made). Less than 5 minuts walk from the Plaza Universitad and less than 10 min from Plaza Catalunya. Good breakfast. And swimming pool / jacuzzi are very enjoyable when you come back at the hotel after a whole day of visit ! ! ! I will keep this address for a next trip in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona, well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Aliye
Reviews.Content: The Sunotel Central is well placed for visiting Barcelona on a short break as we did. It's located on a busy street but the rooms at the rear of the hotel are quiet. The rooms are very well kept, beds made and towels changed everyday. Staff are well informed and speak English if needed. Unfortunately while we were there the weather was pretty bad, cold windy and raining, great pity as there is so much to see. Do invest in the Touristic bus, you can hop on and off all day and see as many sights along the way as you wish,a two day pass cost's 27 euro each but there is no limit as to how many times you get on and off. We took a Ryan Air flight to Gerona and caught the Barcelona Bus outside the airport terminal into Barcelona Nord Estacion, travel time 1 hour and 15 minutes, a return ticket costs 21 Euro, from there across the road to the Metro Red line 1, Arch de Triumph, three stops to the Universitat 1.35Euro Starbucks on the corner and a short walk down that road to the hotel, transport systems is great! This was travelling from Shannon in Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & close to La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: bec_n_craig
Reviews.Content: Stayed 17-20 March Booked flights & hotels with easy jet - £430 for 2 pax from London Staff friendly, requested quiet room after reading reviews and got one at the back of the hotel- 312. This room didnt have wifi available so I needed to sit on the lounges down in reception. Air-con didnt work and it was so hot, the sun comes streaming in on this side of the hotel in the morning so it felt like an oven. We didnt complain about the aircon as we just opened the window and this was sufficient, but on out last night we returned to a freezing room, so they must have fixed it during the day if a maid noticed it didnt work. We used the pool / spa once, although the weather was a lovely 18 degrees there was a chill to the air once getting out. The spa wasnt hot, rather lukewarm. We were on a room only package and didnt eat at the premises, but there are many cafes close by. A 5 min walk to the Metro. Although there was nothing wrong with our stay, if I were to return to Barcelona, I would probably stay somewhere else, in a different area.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: qb20
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via priceline - bid 80 USD for a 4-star hotel in Las Ramblas area. We were overall pleased with our stay, but the 4-star ranking is misleading and should be a 3-star. The rooms were lovely, even large for European standards, as were the bathrooms. However, the previous reviews about street noise are spot on! The first night we had a room with a balcony overlooking the main road - including the EIGHT lanes of traffic. EIGHT LANES. And seemingly paper thin windows. The next night we were able to change to an interior room - while it was smaller, we were much more satisfied with the peace and quiet! So make sure to specify an interior room if possible. We were disappointed that the pool was not available. Also note that the location is about 5-10 minutes walk from Place Catalunya, a bit further from Las Ramblas. We booked this last minute, but with a bit more research a better deal might have been possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not What it all Seems- misleading”
Reviews.Author: Miller2009
Reviews.Content: positives clean, friendly staff, and central ......negatives..... there are no kettles in room.....necessary if you are making baby bottles!!!........pay tv, means your tv is paid for not that you can order movies and there are no english speaking channels............pc for guests means you can use a pc if you have one with you not that there is one available ............rooms noisey due to busy road outside hotel.........no real bar there reception area is where you can have drinks.......cannot order food for room service only restuarant under hotel which needs to be pre-booked not a regular restaurant its a dinner with show dance.....found website misleading..........

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: moll007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sunotel Central as part of a four day sightseeing/city break with a friend. It is very easy to access the hotel from the airport. Only disadvantage is that if you map it the directions are incorrect, we ended up going around the block!! If you take the aerobus and get off at Urgel go with the flow of traffic or Universtat. It is on the main road, not off it as shown on the maps. The only complaint I had with our stay is that we were given a room to the front of the hotel with a balcony and the main road outside is very noisy with traffic, especially during rush hour - between 6.30am and 8 am. The staff were friendly, spoke great english and were super efficient. The room was basic but roomy and comfortable. The pool is very small but plenty of sunloungers to relax. All in all we were very glad with our stay. It was very accessible to all the main areas, very clean and reasonably priced. I would certainly stay there again if I went to Barcelona and recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good location... not so sure about the air con!”
Reviews.Author: Holly_82
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I stayed in this hotel on the 18th and 19th of October and we booked this hotel due to the mostly good reviews on trip advisor. We arrived at 7:30pm and thankfully had the address printed out - the taxi driver wans't too sure where the place was as it's a new hotel and google maps actually places the hotel about 500 meters away from where it is (so don't use it to find out!) We checked in and the bloke at the desk was rather abrupt - not totally rude, but hardly welcoming. Sod it, we were tired... so we went up to the room and were very pleasantly surprised. It was very clean, a good size and we were more than happy. 2 days later... we had noticed a few 'niggles' which were: 1) An exposed wire underneath the bathroom sink - it wasn't connected to anywhere and it looked rather dangerous 2) The lowest the air-con would go was 19 degrees and we couldn't open any windows - therefore we found it quite hard to sleep as it was very hot 3) On Saturday night we heard quite a lot of shouting from outside which continued for a while (Ok.. not the hotels fault, I guess!) We stayed room only so can't comment on the breakfast. The next morning, we asked for directions and the young woman on the desk was incredibly polite and helpful - she sold us the 'bus touristic' tickets (well worth it) and off we went. When checking out, we were allowed to store our luggage in a room next to reception and the young woman booked us a taxi which arrived on time. It cost us 25 Euros to get a taxi from the airport and 31 Euros to get one to the airport. Whilst the Univeristat stop really isn't that far away, we arrived when it was dark and thought it would be safer for 2 young women to take a taxi directly to the hotel. The hotel is in a good location for sightseeing - a 15 minute walk to Las Ramblas and there are loads of tapas places very close by (10 feet or so) so you have a wide variety of food, should you not wish to eat in the hotel. We had room service the first night and were very impressed - it arrived within 20 minutes and was very cheap - 16 Euros for dinner (and that included the 3 Euro surcharge for room service). Would we stay there again? I'd say probably - it certainly wasn't a 'bad' hotel and even the grumpy bloke seemed more pleasant the next time we saw him (I guess everyone has bad days). I would say the main worry would be the temperature of the rooms at night time - we slept without any covers and were still hot!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, central hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: DollyDimpel
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Barcelona for her first time in September for 4 nights. The hotel is new and most taxi drivers we met found it difficult to find! I would recommend you write down the address and keep it on your person at all times and tell the drivers it is new. They seemed to find this helpul. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming and spoke excellent English. This is not a 'happening' hotel and appeared to be half empty. The people in it seemed to be 'older' travellers, (by that I mean over 40 like myself !). There appeared to be buisness travellers also. As previous reviews, the bar was hardly ever open but we weren't too concerned as there is a bar on the corner who serve excellent G & T's! We had a room at the back of the hotel as we requested a quiet room. It had no balcony which was dissappointing but I believe the balcony rooms face the noisy main road anyway. The room was clean and the only lacking item was a kettle/tea and coffee but not unusual in Spanish hotels. Breakfast was good and plenty of choice. We sat around the pool a couple of afternoons and although it wasnt warm enough to swim it appeared to be well looked after. Overall I would stay in this hotel again and would also recommend it but maybe not to same sex groups who want a partying weekend. The highlight of the week was of course being there for Merce week, not to be missed. The processions and fireworks were fantastic and if you get to go this particular week in September you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great trip!”
Reviews.Author: laticslass
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September 2008. Requested a quiet room on a high floor, which we got. Nextdoor but one to lift, but couldn't hear it or people going in and out. Spacious, well decorated room, with a good sized bathroom. Towels changed every day. Reception staff very helpful, even delivering an extra pillow within a few mins even though we forgot to ask for it until returning to the hotel late at night. Allowed us to store luggage on last day as our flight wasn't until the evening. Hotel handily located for metro. Plenty of little cafes to eat breakfast within a few yards of hotel entrance, which were a lot cheaper than hotel breakfast. Pool seemed a reasonable size with quite a few loungers - adequate for a hotel which I'm guessing most would use for sight-seeing rather than sunbathing. Would definately stay here again if visiting Barcelona. Only complaint is we were led to believe there was internet access but this was actually only WiFi. Recommend getting a Barcelona card which offers discounts to various places and in restaurants, as well as free travel on metro & buses. Would also recommend a night trip on the Bus Touristic, which isn't widely advertised - 2-2.5hr trip to see all the main sights lit up at night, plus a 30min stop at the Magic Fountains, and a very impressive view over the city from Montjuic.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great trip.”
Reviews.Author: RacheyJ
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at this hotel as part of a 3 night package after seeing good reviews on Tripadvisor. As described in reviews, the hotel is located a 2 min walk from Universitat metro/Aerobus drop off stop so we took the Aerobus from the airport. The Aerobus bus stop is just outside the terminal building so there are no roads to cross and we found it excellent value and very convenient as only took about 30 mins to get from the airport to Universitat. On arrival, hotel staff were polite and obliging and allowed us to check into our room 3 hours earlier than stated on our confirmation. They were friendly throughout our stay offering to book a taxi on our departure and the use of a store room for our suitcase after we had checked out rather than carrying it around Barcelona with us! Our room was situated at the back of the hotel so overlooked lots of other roof terraces. Although there wasn’t much to see, the room was quiet and we didn’t spend too much time looking out so the view wasn’t that important to us anyway. The room was very clean and had all features as described on the website i.e. hairdryer, mini bar, safe etc. We didn’t eat in the hotel so can’t comment on that. Had a look at the rooftop pool which although not massive was surrounded by sun loungers and would probably be enough to offer a nice dip after a day’s sightseeing. In terms of location, the hotel is about a 10 min stroll from Placa Catalunya which is the start of Las Ramblas so we found it well located especially in getting to the Bus Turistic buses (an excellent way of seeing Barcelona and only 26 Euros for a 2 day pass on all 3 routes) which also depart from there. One word of caution is that the Aerobus only drops off at Universitat and does not pick up from here so to catch the Aerobus to the airport, you will need to go to the Aerobus stop at Placa Catalunya which is located opposite the Bus Turistic bus stops on the east side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but..............”
Reviews.Author: DJDNC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a v. good location within 15 mins walk of plaza cat. but if you're looking for any sort of luxury then forget it. Room we had was adequate although as a twin room bedside cabinet on one side of the bed only. Steps to toilet - tricky in middle of night. View awful. No idea of weather outside. 6 coat hangers I think. And above all bar never seemed to be open. Sounds as if we didn't enjoy our stay which is wrong, just a few things to comment over esp. if you are not nimble.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable this hotel is highly ranked”
Reviews.Author: eurojunk
Reviews.Content: The moment I got in to the hotel - I realized I had made a huge mistake. The guy at the front desk was rude, did not say hello and promptly told me he couldnt find the reservation. Finally, went up to a room - it really is just a room. The walls are paper thin and the doors poorly made. Every time someone on your floor walks out the room, the entire place vibrates. So forget getting any sleep at the hotel. Did I mention sleep? How about a rock for the bed? The vents are interesting - I heard a British lady throwing up all morning then arguing with her husband. Its one of those hotels where you have to put the key in to turn on the lights. That's fine - but could you tell me before I come up? I spent 15 minutes trying to figure it out. Oh yeah and the phone doesnt work, the bathroom door wont shut and the closet door is broken. Why would anyone stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlanZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sunotel for two nights in September. Got a fantastic deal on Last minute for £480 for two people including return flights with BA. This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel but it is more like a 2/3 star. The room is very very small and when we asked for an upgrade, they said they only have these standard rooms meaning either with/without a balcony, one/two double beds. Although small, it is clean. Things that you would take for granted at a 4 star hotel is not available e.g. no ironing boards and internet. Location: Cabs are really cheap so this isn’t a big plus even if it is a 5-10 minute walk to Las Ramblas. There is so much more to Barcelona than Las Ramblas. Head down Rambla del Poblenou where there are many restaurants etc. Barcelona is a fantastic city and three days was definitely not enough time for a first time visitor We did not venture to the rooftop pool as we were on a tight timeframe. If we had a choice, we would rather go to the beachfront as it is a short drive in a cab and costs about 8-10 Euro. There are cocktail bars on the beach, (Platja Bogatell) and you can also hire sun loungers for about 5 Euro. The bars play chill out music and they also serve food. In conclusion, we enjoy staying at more upmarket hotels and at a push, would only return if it's part of a very very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “good holiday”
Reviews.Author: travellover101
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really good location, we walked to most places in about 5-10mins. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to the metro. Was definetely 4 star standard the rooms were cleaned every day , and to a hight standard.The rooftop pool was lovely we loved relaxing for a while up there. Did not try the restaurant facilities, the staff were very helpful if we needed anything I would definetely return to this hotel. I would go back to Barcelona there is loads 2 see and do, but would go out of juky/august as it was sweltering in the day.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunotel Central
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 570, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
